newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish shares ease, outlook mixed for next week.
newsitem.headline: Polish shares ease, outlook mixed for next week.

text.p: Polish shares eased in slightly higher turnover on Thursday but analysts said that though stronger buying after price-fixing signalled growth on Friday, it was not clear where the market would go from there.
The main market's WIG index fell 0.2 percent to 13,696.7, and turnover rose 1.9 percent to 84.1 million zlotys ($30 million) on both markets as 51 issues fell, 22 rose, and 10 were flat.
Some analysts said the bourse could extend its three-week horizontal trend as no fresh signals were in sight.
"We are still in a horizontal trend and...I see no factors which could help create a clear direction for the market," said Mateusz Andrzejewski, an analyst at Pekao SA brokerage.
But others saw the positive economic climate as an impulse strong enough to help the bourse climb next week.
Some analysts said the market could pierce 14,000 points.
Analysts said the central bank deputy head's Tuesday comments on a possible rise in interest rates next year was bringing some uncertainty to the bourse.
But they said the uncertainty was unlikely to significantly influence the market.
Polish brewer Zywiec plunged nine percent in a 1.8-million- zloty turnover ($0.6 million) in reaction to Wednesday's unexpected surge, analysts said.
Continuous trade turnover was at three million zlotys ($1.1 million) with four stocks rising, one falling and one flat.
Mass privatisation NFI units rose 2.4 percent in 17.8-million-zloty ($6.4 million) continuous trade and fell 1.3 percent in 38.6-million zloty ($13.8 million) turnover in the regular session.
